#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Deokso
#Text=Deokso ( 덕소 ) is a town in Gyeonggi province , near Seoul in South Korea .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Deokso is a small town east of Guri in the Gyeonggi province of South Korea .
#Text=It is 12 miles east of Seoul .
#Text=Deosko was for a long time detached from Seoul , which is visible in the traditional areas of the town .
#Text=Since the opening of a subway station , the town has experienced an increase in modern housing developments and general population .
#Text=By subway
#Text=Deokso is on the Jungnang line of Seoul Subway System .
#Text=The station is around 45 minutes from Yongsan station and 10 minutes from Guri .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There are lots of buses from all over the province to Deokso which run regularly .
#Text=There is a direct bus from Incheon Airport which runs 6 times a day .
#Text=By car
#Text=Deosko is accessible from nearby Maseok and Guri in under 20 minutes .
#Text=By foot
#Text=It is possible to walk from Guri to Deokso .
#Text=If you walk towards the Han river and turn left away from Seoul , it s a soothing 2 hour walk to Deokso down the river .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Due to Deokso 's size , the majority of the town can be seen on foot , although buses and taxis are both inexpensive and frequent .
#Text=See
#Text=The Restaurant Plane .
#Text=The Boeing 747-121 , registration N747PA .
#Text=This was the first 747 ' Jumbo Jet ' ever to be commercially flown but was decommisioned after crashing in 1971 .
#Text=It had logged 2,900 hours of operation at the time of the accident .
#Text=The remarkable plane has been converted into a restaurant and can be visited on foot , only a twenty minute walk from the station .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Pizza
#Text=School
#Text=, Next to the Train Station .
#Text=( Take a right out of the main entrance of the train station . ) .
#Text=If you want cheap pizza , welcoming service , and above average cardboard then Pizza School is the place for you .
#Text=Do n't let the vaguely education themed garish decor put you off , this is a real gem .
#Text=The woman who runs the place is very welcoming and has just started to learn English for her expanding foreign customer base .
#Text=The man who makes the pizza does n't talk much though .
#Text=However what is important to understand is that meat pizza is only ₩5,000 .
#Text=All you have to do is say combination pizza and the woman will always say one .
#Text=It is advised you say yes .
#Text=Then there will be the phrase " 10 minute " , which will get cuter with every time you order .
#Text=Cheap .
#Text=The Galbi Place , New Deokso ( The other side of the train station ) .
#Text=Galbi is a delicious treat enjoyed by many in Korea .
#Text=This restaurant is the prime supplier of tasty galbi to hungry Deoksonians .
#Text=If you exit the train station on the side no one else does and pass GS25 and turn left you are on the correct road .
#Text=To recognise this restaurant look for a large eatery with lots of tables with grills in the middle .
#Text=Then , once inside if you want meat on your grill then order galbi sal .
#Text=Galbi is best enjoyed in large groups as this reduces the cost of the meal .
#Text=This is the most cost effective and taste effective restaurant for Galbi in Deokso .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Deokso has a fairly modest selection of bars and no night clubs .
#Text=Drinks will be less expensive than Seoul and draft beer is available in several Hofs and the following establishments .
#Text=Bar No. 9 .
#Text=Friendly staff and a US theme in this late-opening bar .
#Text=Garten Bier .
#Text=German bar and restaurant on the top floor of the building next to the Subway station .
#Text=The tables have built in refridgerators to keep your 3 pint tall glass cold and fresh .
#Text=Bier Hause .
#Text=Deokso 's second German themed bar has a good selection of sausages and dark beers .
#Text=Close to the airplane , a taxi from the station should cost no more than ₩3,000 .
#Text=OB Bar .
#Text=Simple bar with good service and plenty of room to sit outdoors during the summer .
